subtitle: Traditionally, Eve's pudding is made by topping partially cooked apples with a sponge mixture, and then baking this until the sponge is firm. The following recipe is a slight variation on this and gives a more interesting and lighter-textured pudding.

method.text: Put the apples, water and granulated sugar in a large pan. Bring to the boil then simmer for 10-15 min, until the apples have formed a thick pulp.
Drain the apricots thoroughly, reserving the juice. Carefully slice the fruit. Mix the apricots with the apples and place in a lightly greased 1 <sup>3</sup>/<sub>4</sub> litre ovenproof pie dish.
Heat the butter or margarine in a large saucepan. Stir in the flour and cook very gently for 2 min.
Blend in the milk and vanilla essence until all is incorporated. Whisk as the sauce comes to the boil and becomes very thick. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the reserved apricot juice.
Separate the eggs, beat the yolks and stir into the milk mixture. Meanwhile, whisk the egg whites in a clean bowl, whisk in the caster sugar, and fold into the milk mixture.
Spoon over the apple and apricot mixture and bake in the oven for 35 min.
Dredge with a little icing sugar and serve immediately.

title: Apricot Eve's pudding
